titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Z. Shepard Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Emily Ferrigno and Mary Jones

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 01:01

did.abstract: Thomas Z. Shepard is a 12-time Grammy Award winner, producing both Classical and Broadway projects. The collection contains a wide variety of material relating to Shepard's work at Columbia and RCA Victor from approximately 1960-1990, along with some personal materials dating from the early 2000s. The largest part of the collection comprises production materials, such as text, music, and correspondence related to specific projects, and photographs taken during recording sessions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas Z. Shepard was born in 1936, in Orange, New Jersey. He studied music at Juilliard, Oberlin College, and Yale University. In 1960, Shepard began his tenure at Columbia Records, where he spent fourteen years working under Goddard Lieberson. He later worked as co-director of CBS Masterworks, before moving to RCA in 1974. He held an executive position as Division Vice President of RCA Red Seal until 1986, and then worked in MCA's division for Broadway and Classical music until 1989. Since 1989, Shepard has worked as an independent producer, arranger, expert legal witness, and as a lecturer on both musical theater and classical music.

Shepard is a 12-time Grammy Award winner, and has produced a wide variety of Classical and Broadway projects. He produced a number of Stephen Sondheim musicals as well as original cast recordings of 1776, La Cage aux Folles, 42nd Street, Ain't Misbehavin' and Raisin. Shepard produced hundreds of classical recordings and worked with a wide range of twentieth century composers including Leonard Bernstein, Pierre Boulez, Vladimir Horowitz, Leontyne Price, Placido Domingo, and many others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a wide variety of material relating to Shepard's work at Columbia and RCA Victor from approximately 1960-1990, along with some personal materials dating from the early 2000s. The largest part of the collection comprises production materials, such as text, music, and correspondence related to specific projects, and photographs taken during recording sessions. Given Shepard's dedication to musical theater, the lion's share of the project files relate to musical theater productions, though some classical projects are represented. Beyond production materials, the collection also contains personal and business correspondence and publicity materials collected by Shepard such as clippings, programs, and record magazines. The collection contains a small number of sound recordings (test pressings, CDs, and tapes).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into eight series. Series I: Scores; Series II: Project Files, c. 1967-1995; Series III: Photographs and Slides, c. 1968-2008; Series IV: Awards, 1968-2005; Series V: Correspondence, c. 1967-2000; Series VI: Clippings, programs and publicity materials, c. 1960-1994; Series VII: Sound recordings and test pressings, 1961 - 2014; and Series VIII: Diaries, documents and miscellaneous notes, c. 1962-2002.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MSS 112, the Thomas Z. Shepard Papers in the Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vocal/piano score with extensive markings. Also includes correspondence between Shepard and Barry Reiss (MCA Records' attorney).

did.unittitle: Concerto for Orchestra by Bela Bartok

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full score with extensive markings. Includes notes from recording sessions with Pierre Boulez and the New York Philharmonic (produced by Shepard).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Projects files series contains a variety of materials relevant to Shepard's recording projects, including correspondence, sheet music, project-related business documents, and publicity materials. The files are organized alphabetically by project title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes music for "The Invincible Upright" and "The Ancient Upright."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains one folder labeled "Guys and Dolls and Follies Relevant info."

did.unittitle: National Academy of the Recording Arts and Sciences
A Set of Lyrical Jokes for a Friend
Sunday in the Park with George
The Things We Do For Love
"Two by Two" - Danny Kaye and Richard Rodgers (signed)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: signed photograph of Richard Rodgers and Danny Kaye, who were collaborators with Shepard on the production "Two by Two."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session for 1976 release of Porgy and Bess by RCA with cast of Houston Grand Opera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session for 1976 release of Porgy and Bess by RCA with cast of Houston Grand Opera. File contains some photos from another project, likely the 1980 cast recording of 42nd Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session for 1976 release of Porgy and Bess by RCA with cast of Houston Grand Opera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session for 1976 release of Porgy and Bess by RCA with cast of Houston Grand Opera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session for 1976 release of Porgy and Bess by RCA with cast of Houston Grand Opera. File contains other photographs, possibly from the 1980 recording of 42nd Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various photographs of family and friends. Most photographs were printed and dated c. 1980s, but some photographs are old, undated keepsakes (perhaps from his family or early years).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various photographs of family and friends. Most photographs were printed and dated c. 1980s, but some photographs are old, undated keepsakes (perhaps from his family or early years).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from original cast recording of Raisin (produced by Shepard, 1973).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: File contains production photos from the original cast recording of Side by Side by Sondheim, as well as additional studio photographs and family photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted photographs from meetings with at the recording studio. File contains a group of photographs from an unidentified recording session with large orchestra and choir.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photos from recording session for cast recording of 42nd Street. File also includes other production photos with studio colleagues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pictures from an awards ceremony featuring Leontyne Price (1982). File also includes some photos of recording studios during production of 42nd Street (1980)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photos from recording session for cast recording of 42nd Street. File also includes other production photos with studio colleagues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from production and recording studios for several shows, including 42nd Street (1980).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session for 1976 release of Porgy and Bess by RCA with cast of Houston Grand Opera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from original folder labeled "MCA: Shepard Head Shot." File contains primarily negatives and copies of Shepard's head shot, as well as a few other business related photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs documenting cast recording of Oklahoma! for RCA, 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted photographs, primarily family members and home/yard.

did.unittitle: Assorted Photographs - Family and Metropolitan Opera/RCA Event

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted photographs, primarily family members and home/yard. File also contains photos of Metropolitan Opera and RCA gala/event (exact event unknown).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted production photographs from recording studio and other events. File contains photographs of Shepard in the studio with Angela Lansbury (for recording of Sweeney Todd, 1979) and Yul Brenner (for The King and I, 1977), as well as at other work events (e.g. Grammy awards).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photographs from 1979 cast recording of Sweeney Todd, feat. Angela Lansbury

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted color photos of family members at home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two formal photos of family members (possibly parents). Taken in front of a cruise ship and at a venue in New York State. Undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assortment of photographs from events and performances related to Camelot and My Fair Lady. Most Camelot photographs printed from online news source.

did.unittitle: Production photographs with Conductor Pierre Dervaux

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photographs from recording sesssion with orchestra feat. Pierre Dervaux, Richard Tucker, and Nicholas Flagello.

did.unittitle: Assorted Event Photographs and Head Shots

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files include several prints of Shepard's head shots, photographs from business events, and a couple of misc. production photographs (one incl. Rudolph Serkin).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publicity event for Follies (feat. Stephen Sondheim and Elaine Stritch). File also contains a few additional production photographs from unidentified show.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 3 photographs, 2 of a woman (undated, unidentified) and one of Shepard's daughter (dated Nov. 8 1969).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photographs from recording sessions. Includes photographs from recording of Two by Two (1970), orchestral work with Pierre Dervaux and Richard Tucker, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photos (and select head shots) related to recordings with various artists incl. Ernst Haefliger (Tenor), Pierre Dervaux, Jennie Tourel, Viktor Fuchs, Benjamin Kohon, Herbert Borodkin, and others.

did.unittitle: Sunday in the Park with George, cast recording

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of recording session for original cast album feat. Bernadette Peters, Mandy Patinkin, Stephen Sondheim, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from recording session with Stephen Sondheim (unidentified musical).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From folder, originally labeled with the following information: "Barnes and Noble Follies, SS @ Follies, RCA Opera Party, Naras @ La Guardia High, La Mancha, Skywalker Newspaper Story, 8X10s."

did.unittitle: Personal Photographs and Photograph with Jimmy Carter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an assortment of family and personal photos, several of which are labeled "Lisbon '78." Includes large color photograph of quartet playing for President Jimmy Carter. Photo signed by performers.

did.unittitle: Leontyne Price, Marilyn Horne in Concert at the Met

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photographs and photographs from press event for recording entitled "Leontyne Price, Marilyn Horne in Concert at the Met" with James Levine, as well.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production photographs from recording session of Stephen Sondheim's Pacific Overtures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three color photos. One labeled "Ivor Schlossberg, Previn, Ian McClay, TZS, All Saints Church" from July 1986. One of Shepard alone, no date. And a third with caption "The Magic Flute, Vienna, Sept. 1-4, 1980." File contains unmarked negatives (possibly unrelated to the printed photographs).

did.unittitle: Side by Side by Sondheim, Original London Cast Recording

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of recording session of Side by Side by Sondheim, featuring Original London Cast (1976).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photos from recording of Stephen Sondheim's Company, 1970. File also includes photographs featuring others (e.g. Leonard Bernstein), but most appear to be related to the Company recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from a variety of recording productions and events. Files feature pictures of Stephen Sondheim, Leontyne Price, Hal Prince, Danny Kaye, Barbra Streisand, Julie Andrews (1995) and several others (at work events, etc.)

did.physdesc: Albums have been disassembled for preservation purposes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted production photographs. Some photos feature corporate events, and other feature recording projects. Subjects include Leonard Bernstein, Yul Brenner, Leontyne Price, and many others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted production photographs. Some photos feature corporate events, and other feature recording projects. Subjects include Leonard Bernstein, Yul Brenner, Leontyne Price, and many others. Some photographs taken at a New York Chapter of National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences awards ceremony.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted photographs from recording sessions and corporate events. Subjects include Stephen Sondheim, La Cage aux Folles recording session, Budapest String Quartet, among others. One group of photos labeled "King Island Christmas Listening Party 1999."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal photos of garden and home. One photo dated April 1939 of a small boy (likely Shepard).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted recording sessions. Subjects include symphonic work with Pierre Dervaux conducting, Danny Kaye (Two by Two cast recording), and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cast Recording of Sunday in the Park with George (Stephen Sondheim) feat. Bernadette Peters and Mandy Patinkin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Slides for Carousel Recording c. 1987. Steve J. Sherman "Originals."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plaques and paper certificates commemorating a variety of recording-industry nominations and awards. Organized chronologically.

Grammy Nomination, Classical Producer of the Year
Paper certificates, nominations, and award-related memorabilia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes several paper certificates and award nominations from various organizations (Grammy nominations, National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences, Van Cliburn Foundation, National Television Academy, and others). File also includes a brochure from the Twelfth Annual Grammy Awards (1970) and a "Grammy Awards Book" from 1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain business correspondence (on CBS or RCA letterhead) as well as personal correspondence, including greeting cards and friendly letters. Some letters contain information relevant to recording projects, and may correspond to files in the Projects Series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Topical categories are indicated on the front of each folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain both personal correspondence (greeting cards, etc.) and business correspondence. Correspondents include Stephen Sondheim, associates from EMI Classics, and many other close friends and colleagues from across the recording industry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain both personal correspondence (greeting cards, etc.) and business correspondence. Correspondence relevant to Man of La Mancha, Sony collaborations, and other projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain a large assortment of materials including individual newspaper clippings relating to productions by Shepard, whole issues of trade magazines (e.g. Billboard, Cash Box), programs from live performances, occasional poster or publicity materials for productions Shepard was involved with, and much more.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material is divided by folder according to material type (e.g. magazines, programs).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include newspaper clippings, annotated articles, concert and show programs, and magazines. Subjects include Broadway shows and recordings, classical recordings and concerts, feature articles on Tom Shepard and RCA, and articles on the recording market.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily copies of industry magazines and publications, including issues of Billboard, Record World, The New York Times, Cash Box, and others. Files contain some single-page clippings and concert programs, as well.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain clippings, publicity materials, and magazines relating to several shows produced by Shepard. Shows mentioned include Porgy and Bess, Love in Two Countries, a commemorative program at the O'Neill Theater (1989), and others. Clippings from publications such as The New Yorker, Cash Box, and People Magazine. Files also include some personal notes and letters relating to clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains fourteen sound recordings in various formats, for the following shows/artists: Gypsy Live; Gilbert and Sullivan's Thespis; Robert Ronan; Stokowski conducting the Philadelphia Orchestra (Beethoven Symphony No. 3); Harold Arlen and Barbra Streisand; Lena Horne; Blue Paris; Spanish Fly; assorted songs; Blaming it on You (auditions).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Assorted correspondence, writings, sketches, business documents, and personal documents that do not immediately correspond to recording projects in Projects Series. Organized by subject (indicated in title of file).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, alumni magazines, and documentation relating to Shepard's alma mater, Oberlin Conservatory of Music. Some materials relate to reunions and alumni activities.

did.unittitle: Greg Varner, "The Romance of the Phonograph Days" (drafts)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript draft and letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mock-up advertisements/proof sheets for albums on MCA Records/MCA Classics.

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Shepard (clipping and camp progress report)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous notes and drafts of musical numbers (shows unknown) and written material (likely speeches). Also contains printouts of CD reviews and other misc. material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials relating to recording projects such as lists of album releases (business materails), photo credits relating to record releases, blank Columbia Records Session Data Sheets, and other materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diaries annotated with scheduling and agendas.
